intro: Exolobus rotatus, commonly known as the Cape mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Exolobus rotatus is adapted to arid conditions and is an important component of its native ecosystems.
